section.title: Deriving Formulas for Increasing and Decreasing Annuities
section.p: In this optional section, we will derive the formulas for (Is)_{\angln} and (Da)_{\angln} using chunking.

introduction.p: To lay a foundation, write the series representations for each of the following (a timeline may help). You will have to recognize these series representations in the derivation.
We will derive the formula for (Is)_{\angln} first. We will do this in two steps.

task.p: Make a timeline for an increasing annuity with payments of 1, 2, ..., n. But chunk the annuity so that you have a bunch of level-payment annuities, each of which has payments of 1, but has different terms.

Use your timeline to write down an expression using a bunch of s_{\angl{k}} terms whose value is equal to (Is)_{\angln}. Then use the formula for each s_{\angl{k}} to derive the formula for (Is)_{\angln}. At some point in your work, you should see one of the series representations above.

statement.p: Adapt what you did to find an equation for (Da)_{\angln}.
Now that you have derived the formulas for (Is)_{\angln} and (Da)_{\angln}, how would you find the rest of the formulas for increasing and decreasing annuities?
